definition: to run neck and neck/to keep pace with/to keep abreast of/on a par with one another
and/furthermore/also/together with/(not) at all/simultaneously/to combine/to join/to merge
to combine/to amalgamate
variant of 並|并[bing4]
surname Jia
to harness/to draw (a cart etc)/to drive/to pilot/to sail/to ride/your good self/prefixed word denoting respect (polite 敬辞)
(name of states and dynasties at several different periods)/surname Qi
neat/even/level with/identical/simultaneous/all together/to even sth out
to expel/to urge on/to drive/to run quickly
old variant of 驅|驱[qu1]
variant of 驅|驱[qu1]

sentences.english: Yes, he is neck and neck with Ian.
sentences.chinese: 是的，他与伊恩并驾齐驱了。

sentences.english: Mongolian  conqueror Genghis Khan is riding a horse opposite  Napoleon.
sentences.chinese: “一代天骄”成吉思汗骑在马上与拿破仑并驾齐驱。

sentences.english: NBC and Fox were neck-and-neck for second place.
sentences.chinese: 美国国家广播公司同福克斯公司并驾齐驱排在第二位。

sentences.english: Of course, often, I think, people run together these two questions.
sentences.chinese: 当然，我想通常，这两个问题都是并驾齐驱的。

sentences.english: He bore up with his classmates.
The two horses were neck and neck all the way down to the wire.
sentences.chinese: 一直到终点两匹马都并驾齐驱，互不相让。

sentences.english: Four chariots could drive alongside each other on top of its enormous wall.
sentences.chinese: 围绕它的城墙坚厚宽阔，足够四辆战车并驾齐驱。

sentences.english: Logistics" and "network in unison across the various media.
sentences.chinese: 物流“和”网络并驾齐驱，在种种媒介上纵横驰骋。

sentences.english: I will be able to stay with Johnson in the first 50 metres.
sentences.chinese: 在头50米，我能与约翰逊并驾齐驱跑得一样快。

sentences.english: This is comparable with the peaks of isolationist sentiment after the Vietnam war and after the cold war ended.
sentences.chinese: 这同越战及暗斗后孤破情感的高峰并驾齐驱。

sentences.english: In the gymnastic contest, the two teams kept abreast with each other.
sentences.chinese: 在体操比赛中，两支队伍并驾齐驱。

sentences.english: ABC and Fox were neck-and-neck for second place.
sentences.chinese: 美国国家广播公司同福克斯公司并驾齐驱排在第二位。

sentences.english: Mongolian conqueror Genghis Khan is riding a horse opposite Napoleon.
sentences.chinese: “一代天骄”成吉思汗骑在立刻与拿破仑并驾齐驱。

sentences.english: His car was abreast of the leading car.
sentences.chinese: 他的车和跑在头里的车并驾齐驱。

sentences.english: She bore up with her schoolmates.
sentences.chinese: 她与她的同学们并驾齐驱。

definition: equally matched/about the same
to go forward together (idiom); to undertake simultaneous tasks/going hand in hand
peer competition/to function as rivals/to make claims as an equal
to be on an equal footing
lit. late-comer lives above (idiom); the up-and-coming youngster outstrips the older generation/the pupil surpasses the master
lit. unable to distinguish eldest brother from second brother (idiom); they are all equally excellent/nothing to choose between them
to discuss two disparate things together (idiom); to mention on equal terms/to place on a par with/(often with negatives: impossible to mention X in the same breath as Y)
equally famous
two remarkable persons living at the same period (as 周瑜[Zhou1 Yu2] and 諸葛亮|诸葛亮[Zhu1 ge3 Liang4])

to come first in triennial palace examinations (idiom, refers to the carved stone turtle head in front of the imperial palace, next to which the most successful candidate in the imperial examinations was entitled to stand)/to be the champion/to be the very best in any field
contend against
to overtake
to stand side by side/to be juxtaposed
not to know one's place
well-matched/equally matched
to be shoulder to shoulder/to be on an equal level with/Taiwan pr. [bi4 jian1]
